ABLE MATCH (Making Able a Tool to Combat Hardship) Act
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide matching payments for ABLE account contributions by certain individuals, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary:
ABLE MATCH (Making Able a Tool to Combat Hardship) Act
This bill allows beneficiaries of ABLE (Achieving a Better Life Experience) accounts a refundable tax credit to match their contributions to such accounts. The amount of such credit may not exceed $2,000.
The bill also requires demographic reporting (e.g., race, gender, disability type) with respect to ABLE accounts and directs the Department of the Treasury to award grants to states for promoting such accounts and for making matching payments of contributions to such accounts.
